content: Hello, I'm trying my hand at this issue https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/88276 which involves improving the error message on parsing a unary +. The issue mentions the unary plus should be recovered. What does this mean? Does it mean the parser should continue if a unary plus is encountered?
I'm not familiar with how rustc specifically works, but there's a good writeup of error recovery on https://craftinginterpreters.com/parsing-expressions.html#syntax-errors
I see, thanks! What follows a unary plus is likely to be a valid expression, I think it might make sense to consume the unary plus, report an error and continue parsing.
